content: How can I help you today?

I'm not really sure where to start. My wife and I have been having issues at home, mostly because of the challenges we're facing with my son. It's like everything is falling apart, and I don't know how to fix it.

That sounds really tough. You're juggling a lot right now with your wife and your son, and it sounds like it's weighing heavily on you. What's been happening with your son that's been challenging for you?

He's been acting out a lot—tantrums, defiance, and sometimes just completely shutting down. We’ve tried different approaches, but nothing seems to work, and it’s been causing a lot of tension between my wife and me. I feel like we’re constantly at odds about how to handle it.

It sounds like you're feeling stuck, trying to figure out the best way to support your son while also managing the tensions between you and your wife. You're really trying, but it feels like nothing is helping right now. How are you handling all of this for yourself?

Honestly, it’s been really hard. I feel overwhelmed all the time, like I can’t think straight anymore. I can’t focus at work, I don’t feel like doing anything I used to enjoy, and it just feels like there’s no way out of this.

It sounds overwhelming, carrying all of this—trying to be there for your family while feeling like you're losing the things that once kept you grounded. That loss of focus, enjoyment, and hope can be really heavy. What’s most important to you right now as you think about all of this?

What matters most to me is keeping my family together. I want to find a way to help my son, make things better with my wife, and also reconnect with my daughter. I just don't know where to start or how to move forward.

Family is clearly at the center of what matters most to you, and it’s so clear how much you care about strengthening those relationships. It sounds like you’re longing for connection and stability amidst all the challenges. What do you feel is keeping you from moving forward right now?

I think it’s the feeling of being stuck and not knowing what the right path forward is. Every time I try to take a step, it feels like I’m met with resistance, or it just doesn’t work. It’s hard to feel hopeful when nothing seems to make a difference.

Feeling stuck can be incredibly frustrating, especially when you’re putting in effort but aren't seeing progress. It makes sense that it’s hard to feel hopeful under those circumstances. With all that you've tried, what options or approaches do you feel might still be worth exploring—whether big or small?

I honestly don’t even know anymore. We’ve tried talking to him, setting clear boundaries, positive reinforcement, consequences—everything we can think of. I’m open to suggestions, but I feel drained and unsure of what will work. It’s exhausting.

It sounds like you and your wife have really put your heart into trying so many approaches, but the energy it’s taken has left you feeling drained and uncertain. This exhaustion is understandable, given how much you care and want to make things better. Would it be helpful to take a moment to reflect on what’s been most challenging for you emotionally in this process?

I guess the hardest part is feeling like I’m failing as a parent and a husband. No matter how hard I try, I can’t seem to get it right, and that makes me feel like I’m not enough for my family. It’s just really difficult to sit with that feeling every day.

It takes a lot of courage to share how deeply this is affecting you. Feeling like you’re not enough must be incredibly painful, especially when you’re giving so much of yourself to your family. Yet the fact that you care so deeply and are still trying shows how much you mean to them. What would it mean to you to begin shifting that feeling of failure into one of hope or possibility?

It would mean everything, honestly. I just don’t know how to do that right now. It’s hard to see hope when every effort feels like it's hitting a wall, but I want to believe that things can get better. I just need help figuring out how.

It’s clear how much hope means to you and how strong that desire is to turn things around—for yourself and your family. Even when it feels like you’re hitting a wall, the fact that you still want to believe in better possibilities is powerful. Would you like to explore small steps that might help open that door to hope, or is there something else you’d rather talk through first?

It’s clear how much you care about your family and want to make things better. Even though you feel stuck right now, the fact that you’re here and open to figuring it out is a really important step. Do you think there’s one small thing, even if it feels tiny, that could help you start to feel just a little more grounded?

It’s clear how much you care about your family and want to make things better. Even though you feel stuck right now, the fact that you’re here and open to figuring it out is a really important step. Do you think there’s one small thing, even if it feels tiny, that could help you start to feel just a little more grounded?

I’m not sure. I guess even just having someone to talk to feels like a small step in the right direction. Maybe focusing on one thing at a time could help, but I’m not sure where to start with everything that’s going on.

Talking things through can be a powerful step, and it sounds like prioritizing one thing might help ease some of that overwhelming feeling. Choosing where to start can feel tricky when there’s so much happening. Is there one area—your relationship with your son, your wife, or even giving yourself some space to recharge—that feels most pressing to you right now?
